Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain the RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"78rn5","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":"30","guid":"851C0D632D6B4669868D692ED34900ED","id":"12837","label":"Incubate"}}}}

9996.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3skj8","text":"Repeat Step 24 once for a total of two washes. Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube/plate, place back on the magnet and remove traces of ethanol with a p10 pipette tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"40ua8","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"59322CE2CCF54D6D937550FBDD1FB1EB","id":"145","label":"Repeat","step_guid":"375DF2A6D26B4091A135734628A86F63"}}}}

9996.section: RNA Purification after rRNA Depletion Using Agencourt RNAClean XP Beads or NEBNext RNA Sample Purification Beads
9996.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"79phm","text":"Air dry the beads for up to 5 minutes while the tube/plate is on the magnetic stand with the lid open.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"96vou","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4ggcv","text":"Caution: Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of RNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack they are too dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":273}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dd8bl","text":"This NGS workflow describes how to prepare libraries from total RNA with a rRNA depletion step to increase the yield of  non-host RNA transcripts. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"taa3","text":"This workflow was initially designed with the aim of generating full-length hepaciviruses, but can also be used for sequencing any other RNA viral sequences or RNA-related metagenomes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working with NGS library preparation aiming to generate complete hepacivirus genomes from animal samples.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ucun","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jmb4","text":"The quantity of total RNA is evaluated using Qubit RNA BR assay kit (following manufacturer's protocol)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qlbb","text":"The quality of total RNA is evaluated using the Agilent RNA 6000 Nano kit in Bioanalyzer (following the manufacturer's protocol)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co9lo","text":"(based on previous Qubit results and the bioanalyzer kit range, prepare samples dilution 1:10 or else for bioanalyzer)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a039i","text":"Samples with RIN\u003e2 can proceed to the next step of rRNA depletion","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2r6gt","text":"Adjust your starting material, which can be anything between 5 ng–1 µg total RNA (DNA free), according to the Qubit results in a 12 µl total volume reaction with nuclease-free water, and follow the manufacturer's manual of NEBNext rRNA Depletion kit (Human/Mouse/Rat) to remove total rRNA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fr84o","text":"This kit removes any rRNA while retaining the viral RNA. Upon incubation, we evaluate our results using a custom qPCR assay targeting the 12S rRNA and the NS3 genomic region of hepaciviruses. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7u40b","text":"Analogous evaluation is recommended while working with other viruses.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6e9hg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"70edc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"","data":{"id":9996,"title":"NEBNext rRNA Depletion Kit (Human/Mouse/Rat) E6310","title_html":"NEBNext rRNA Depletion Kit (Human/Mouse/Rat) E6310","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"nebnext-rrna-depletion-kit-human-mouse-rat-e6310-mzkc74w","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/u4vi4ze.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/u4vi4ze.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Isabel Gautreau","affiliation":"New England Biolabs","affiliation_url":"","username":"isabel-gautreau","link":"","image":{"source":"/img/avatars/008.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/008.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":30},"type_id":1,"guid":"ACF73F60791D11EC92DBC999B2F39398"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f30a2","text":"Upon rRNA depletion, the RNA product is quantified and qualified using the Qubit RNA BR assay kit (or Qubit RNA HS assay kit based on the results) and the Agilent RNA 6000 Pico kit following manufacturer's protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"78h0k","text":"Based on the Qubit results obtained in step 4, set the total amount of rRNA-depleted RNA input to anything between ~1ng - 100 ng.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8fd49","text":"Follow the protocol of NGS library preparation using the NEXTFLEX Rapid Directional RNAseq kit (NOVA-5138-08) for tissue samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdfcs","text":"(will be released soon, current private link:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48ptp","text":"https://www.protocols.io/private/46D9A030792211ECB5450A58A9FEAC02)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":65}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":65}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"35AFD0FF7A6B11EC96AB0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/private/46D9A030792211ECB5450A58A9FEAC02"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5h0qn","text":"Check the fragment size of your libraries using Bioanalyzer with the Agilent High Sensitivity DNA kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35lj2","text":"(following manufacturer's protocol, starting material: 1 µL)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcgjg","text":"The ideal fragment size for Illumina sequencing should range between 350-500bp. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ntt9","text":"Check the total amount of prepared libraries for pooling and confirm whether the adaptors are well ligated. This can be tested using a qPCR assay for each library with the complete Rox Low kit with Illumina general primers (catalogue number KK4873). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9q04p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6k8b","text":"Prepare dilutions of your DNA libraries in 1:10, 1:1000, and 1:8000 with TET-buffer/nuclease-free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"desuf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csc34","text":"Prepare the master mix as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6k374","text":"KAPA Master Mix 12 µl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dei8","text":"H2O 4 µl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cl9d1","text":"Diluted DNA 4 µl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5i9gt","text":"(total volume 20 µl)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42bh4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqn0v","text":"Load in 96-well plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abvkn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lak9","text":"The PCR cycling conditions are listed below :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2mbp","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fq6lc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CF548A707A9611EC8C792BB61295D500","height":124,"id":269913,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ihu5bh3nf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ihu3bh3nf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ihu4bh3nf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ihu2bh3nf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2vhd","text":"Pool libraries according to the library requirements of your sequencing platform. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6iv73","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2b3ut","text":"Pool together 8-12 libraries (differs according to customers' demands for deep or ultra-deep sequencing) and adjust the volume using the same reagent as the one used for the elution in the library preparation step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ddio","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvqpa","text":"Ready for sequencing!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2p4ga","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: NGS workflow with rRNA depletion for viral RNA sequencing from animal tissue specimens
title_html: NGS workflow with rRNA depletion for viral RNA sequencing from animal tissue specimens

versions.title_html: NGS workflow with rRNA depletion for viral RNA sequencing from animal tissue specimens

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"2fnra","text":"To minimise the effect of index hopping, libraries need to be stored individually at -20 °C. Prepare the pools only when you are ready to send those for sequencing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
